subject: Re: Exception Handling Question
msgSnippet: ... One more possible reason (though not one I had been using) is that JUnit will report these as Error instead of Failure. Probably not an issue for most
messageBody:
--- In junit@egroups.com, kevinb@m... wrote:
> I agree with your model for this type of test case.. but why catch
> unexpected exceptions?

One more possible reason (though not one I had been using) is that
JUnit will report these as Error instead of Failure. Probably not an
issue for most people since the goal is 0 Errors and 0 Failures
anyway. Catching the known exceptions that shouldn't be thrown and
logging Failure gives a slightly more correct test result.

Nonetheless, we started writing tests today that follow the idiom of
letting the undesired exceptions propagate back to the framwork.

Regards,

Rob
